name: Stephanie Luce
position: member of the Board of Governors
body: 109 JUNE 6, 2019 2019-109 1. Under paragraph 9(3)(c) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephan Pelletier, Campbellton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, as an academic staff person nominated by its academic staff, effective June 30, 2019, for a term of three years. 2. Under paragraph 9(3)(d) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Francois Boutot, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a non academic staff person nominated by its non-academic staff, effective June 30, 2019, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Marc-Andre LeBlanc, Eel River Crossing, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Minister, effective June 30, 2019, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11 (1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Melanie Paulin Gagnon, Caraquet, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, effective June 30, 2019, for a term of three years. 109 -2 5. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Luc St-Jarre, St-Jacques, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, effective June 30, 2019, for a term of three years. 6. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11 (1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephanie Luce, Cocagne, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, effective June 30, 2019, for a term of three years. Administrator This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 6June2019. name: Bernard T. LeBlanc
body: 107 JUNE 6, 2019 2019-107 1. Under subsections 9(1) and (2) of the Film and Video Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Shelley Roach Dumouchel, Fredericton, New Brunswick as an adjudicator to conduct hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 2. Under subsections 9(1) and (2) of the Film and Video Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Bernard T. LeBlanc, Moncton, New Brunswick as an adjudicator to conduct hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 3. Under subsections 9(1) and (2) of the Film and Video Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Liza Anne Robichaud, Bathurst, Fredericton, New Brunswick as an adjudicator to conduct hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 4. Under subsection 31 ( 1) of the Gaming Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Shelley Roach Dumouchel, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an adjudicator under the Gaming Control Act, for the purpose of conducting· hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 5. Under subsection 31 (1) of the Gaming Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Bernard T. LeBlanc, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an adjudicator under the Gaming Control Act, for the purpose of conducting hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 6. Under subsection 31(1) of the Gaming Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Liza Anne Robichaud, Bathurst, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an adjudicator under the Gaming Control Act, for the purpose of conducting hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 107 - 2 7. Under subsection 31(4) of the Gaming Control Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor revokes Order in Council 2009-77 dated February 26, 2009. :> J.C. name: Joanne Plourde
body: 108 JUNE 6, 2019 2019-108 Under subsections 2(2) and 3(2) of the Assessment and 1. Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brigitte Ouellette, Grand-Sault, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, for a term of five years, effective June 17, 2019. 2. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michel Vautour, Saint-Ignace, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Two, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 3. Under paragraph 2( 1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Carole Beaulieu, Saint-Jacques, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Ten, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 4. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerard Robichaud, Neguac, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Four, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019. 5. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints David F. Hildebrand, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Nine, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019. 108 -2 6. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul 8. DeMerchant, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Eleven, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019. 7. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Micheline Hachey, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Three, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 8. Under paragraph 2( 1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gilda rd Chiasson, Shippagan, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Three, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 9. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cleveland Allaby, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Eight, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 10. Under subsections 3(3) and 9( 1) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Pierre Brine, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region One, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 11. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Joanne Plourde, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Ten, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 108 -3 12. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 3 of Order in Council 2017 172 dated July 10, 2017. 13. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council revokes section 9 of Order in Council 2017-172 dated July 10, 2017. J.C. name: Louise Duguay Lepage
position: Vice-Chair of the Board of Directors
body: 93 MAY 16, 2019 2019-93 1. Under paragraph 11(1)(a) and subsections 11(2) and 12(1) of the Service New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as member of the Board of Directors of Service New Brunswick, for three-year terms, effective May 16, 2019: (a) Donald Moore, Moncton, New Brunswick; and (b) Karen 0. Taylor, Woodstock, New Brunswick. 2. Under section 14 of the Service New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Louise Duguay Lepage, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Board of Directors of Service New Brunswick, effective May 16, 2019, for a term ending January 1, 2021. 3. Under subsection 7(1) and section 10 of the New Brunswick Health Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Roger Léger, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a member and chairperson of the New Brunswick Health Council, for a term of three years, effective March 28, 2019. 2: Under subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Health Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following as members of the New Brunswick Health Council, for a term of three years, effective March 31, 2019: (a) Susan Harley, Rothesay, New Brunswick; and (b) | Harry Doyle, Lower Coverdale, New Brunswick. 3. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Health Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following as members of the New Brunswick Health Council, for a term of three years, effective March 28, 2019: (a) Eva Sock, Elsipogtog, New Brunswick; and (b) | Mike Doiron, Campbellton, New Brunswick. name: Michael O’Blenis
body: 50 MARCH 21, 2019 2019-50 Under paragraphs 3(1)(c) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael O’Blenis, Fredericton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, as a member representing the forest industries of New Brunswick, effective March 21, 2019, for a term of two years. name: Alain Basque
position: Acting Deputy Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture
body: 50A MARCH 21, 2019 2019-50A 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Alain Basque as Acting Deputy Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture, effective March 20, 2019. 2. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (b) of Order in Council 2016-214 dated September 6, 2016. name: Rosemary Losier
body: 41 MARCH 14, 2019 2019-41 i. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 17.2(1) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons to the Mental Health Review Boards, for a term of five years, effective March 14, 2019: (a) Cheryl Johnson, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2,3 and 7); (b) Kayla Carter, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7); (c) Shelley Dumouchel, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2,3 and 7); (d) Dr. Sergiy Ostashko, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member (psychiatrist) of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6); (e) Rina Arsenault, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7); (f) Luc Blacquiére, Sud Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6); and (g) Thérése Roy, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7). , 41 2; Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 17.2(1) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lucie Robichaud, Baie du Petit-Pokemouche, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6), for a term of five years, effective March 14, 2019. 3. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1), 8(2) and 8(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as Chairs of the Mental Health Tribunal (North and South), for five-year terms, effective March 14, 2019: (a) Donald Cullinan, Saint John, New Brunswick; (b) | George Cooper, Moncton, New Brunswick; (c) Rosemary Losier, Miramichi, New Brunswick; and (d) | Gary Mclaughlin, Edmundston, New Brunswick. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 14 March 2019. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1), 8(2) and 8(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as Chairs of the Mental Health Tribunal (North and South), for five-year terms, effective March 14, 2019: (a) Donald Cullinan, Saint John, New Brunswick; (b) | George Cooper, Moncton, New Brunswick; (c) Rosemary Losier, Miramichi, New Brunswick; and (d) | Gary Mclaughlin, Edmundston, New Brunswick. name: Jean-Marc Dupuis
position: Clerk of the Executive Council, Head of the Public Service and Chief Operating Officer
body: 39 FEBRUARY 28, 2019 2019-39 1. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act and section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jean-Marc Dupuis as Clerk of the Executive Council, Head of the Public Service and Chief Operating Officer, effective March 4, 2019, in place of Judy Wagner. 2. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act and section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Judy Wagner as Deputy Minister of Policy and Legislative Affairs, in addition to her current duties as Secretary to Cabinet, effective March 4, 2019. 3. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Judy Wagner as Deputy Minister of the Aboriginal Affairs Secretariat, effective March 4, 2019, in place of Héléne Bouchard. 4. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Thomas MacFarlane as Deputy Minister of Energy and Resource Development, effective March 4, 2019, in place of Cathy LaRochelle. 5. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Sadie Perron as Deputy Minister of Post- Secondary Education, Training and Labour, effective March 4, 2019, in place of Jean-Marc Dupuis. 39 6. Under section 3 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 21 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Héléne Bouchard as Acting President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective March 4, 2019. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 28 February 2019. name: Mike Wilson
body: 34 FEBRUARY 28, 2019 2019-34 1. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(8), 16(1) and 16(2) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Edward Barrett, Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a director and appoints him as Chair of the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 16, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2021. 2. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(8), 16(1) and 16(2) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Andrew MacGillivray, Saint John, New Brunswick as a director and appoints him as Vice-Chair of the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 16, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2023. 3. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons to the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation: (a) Michael Sellman, River Falls, Wisconsin, United States, effective February 28, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2023; (b) Jennifer Henry, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick, effective April 2, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2019; (c) Judith Athaide, Calgary, Alberta, effective April 2, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2020; (d) Charles Firlotte, Stratfort, Connecticut, United States, effective April 2, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2021; 34 (e) Nancy Whipp, Shediac Bridge, New Brunswick, effective April 2, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2023; (f) Mike Wilson, Sackville, New Brunswick, effective April 2, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2023; (g) | Paul McCoy, Western Springs, Illinois, United States, effective April 16, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2020; (h) Alain Bossé, Saint-Quentin, New Brunswick, effective April 16, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2021; and (i) Barbara Trenholm, Fredericton, New Brunswick, effective April 16, 2019, for a term ending October 1, 2023. 4. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) of the Electricity Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes, effective February 28, 2019: ° paragraph 2(d) of Order in Council 2018-155 dated April 30, 2018; and ° paragraph 3(b) of Order in Council 2015-84 dated April 30, 2015. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 28 February 2019. Deputy Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier suppléant du Conseil exécutif

name: Gerald Cluney
body: 13 JANUARY 30, 2019 2019-13 1. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Geoffrey Bladon, Keswick Ridge, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Labour and Employment Board, for a term of three years, effective February 19, 2019. 2) Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Annie Daneault, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Labour and Employment Board, for a term of three years, effective April 10, 2019. 3. Under paragraph 2(1)(c) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as employee members of the Labour and Employment Board, for terms of three years, effective January 30, 2019: (a) Jacqueline Bergeron-Bridges, Eel River Crossing, New Brunswick; (b) Debbie Gray, Quispamsis, New Brunswick; (c) Pamela Guitard, Bathurst, New Brunswick; (d) Richard MacMillan, St. Stephen, New Brunswick; and (e) Gary Ritchie, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 4. Under paragraph 2(1)(c) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as employer members of the Labour and Employment Board, for terms of three years, effective January 30, 2019: 13 (a) | Gerald Cluney, Moncton, New Brunswick; (b) William Dixon, Moncton, New Brunswick; and (c) | Marco Gagnon, Grand Falls, New Brunswick. name: Marion R. Butler
body: 365 NOVEMBER 28, 2018 2018-365 WHEREAS by Order-in-Council 2016-253 dated October 5, 2016, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council directed a Commission be issued, for the period beginning October 5, 2016, under the Inquiries Act, appointing five persons as commissioners to conduct a National Inquiry into Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls and whereas the Commission was required to deliver a final report before November 1, 2018; WHEREAS on June 6, 2018, the federal government, by Order- in-Council P.C. 2018-0686, amended Order in Council P.C. 2016-736 dated August 2, 2016, to extend the period of the Inquiry until June 30, 2019 and to remove Marilyn Poitras as a Commissioner; WHEREAS it is desirable to extend the period for the Commissioners to submit a final report until April 30, 2019; AND WHEREAS Commissioner Marilyn Poitras resigned on July 5, 2017; NOW THEREFORE, under Section 2 of the Inquiries Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council directs that the Commission of Inquiry established under Order-in-Council 2016-253: (a) continue with the Honourable Marion R. Butler, Michéle Tania Audette, E. Qajaq Robinson and Brian Eyolfson, as Commissioners; and 365 (b) deliver to the Attorney General of the Province of New Brunswick and the Government of Canada a final report, to be submitted before April 30, 2019, setting out the Commissioner's findings and recommendations. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 28 November 2018. Deputy Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier suppléant du Conseil exécutif ative. (roVuI nKor-ps

body: 347 NOVEMBER 9, 2018 2018-347 Under section 2 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant- Governor appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective November 9, 2018: (a) The Honourable Blaine Higgs, Premier and President of the Executive Council; (b) The Honourable Dominic Cardy, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development; (c) The Honourable Mike Holland, Minister of Energy and Resource Development; (d) The Honourable Jeff Carr, Minister of Environment and Local Government; (e) The Honourable Ernie Steeves, Minister of Finance and President of Treasury Board; (f) The Honourable Hugh John (Ted) Flemming, Minister of Health; (g) The Honourable Sherry Wilson, Minister of Service New Brunswick; 347 (h) The Honourable Robert Gauvin, Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture; (i) The Honourable Bill Oliver, Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure; and Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 9 November 2018. name: Bill Oliver
body: 347 NOVEMBER 9, 2018 2018-347 Under section 2 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant- Governor appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective November 9, 2018: (a) The Honourable Blaine Higgs, Premier and President of the Executive Council; (b) The Honourable Dominic Cardy, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development; (c) The Honourable Mike Holland, Minister of Energy and Resource Development; (d) The Honourable Jeff Carr, Minister of Environment and Local Government; (e) The Honourable Ernie Steeves, Minister of Finance and President of Treasury Board; (f) The Honourable Hugh John (Ted) Flemming, Minister of Health; (g) The Honourable Sherry Wilson, Minister of Service New Brunswick; 347 (h) The Honourable Robert Gauvin, Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture; (i) The Honourable Bill Oliver, Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure; and Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 9 November 2018. name: Denis Landry
body: 332 OCTOBER 5, 2018 2018-332 is Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Denis Landry, Acting Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, who shall also be Solicitor General. 2: Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Gilles LePage, Acting Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Labour, Employment and Population Growth. 3: Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Benoit Bourque, Acting Minister of Aquaculture and Fisheries, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Health and the Minister of Service New Brunswick. 4. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Roger Melanson, Acting Minister of Energy and Resource Development, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the President of Treasury Board and the Minister of Post-Secondary Education. 332 5. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Andrew Harvey, Acting Minister of Agriculture, Mines and Rural Affairs, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Environment and Local Government. body: 324 AUGUST 16, 2018 2018-324 1, Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Yves Gagnon, Campbellton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission, effective August 16, 2018, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael Wennberg, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission, effective August 21, 2018, for a term of four years. 3. Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Vincent L. Duff, Hampton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission, effective August 16, 2018, for a term of three years. 4. name: Kevin McKendy
body: 272 JULY 12, 2018 2018-272 fe Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(e) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Victor Somerville, Juniper, New Brunswick, as a member engaged directly as a producer, of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 2. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(c) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert Speer, Holmesville, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the Dairy Farmers of New Brunswick, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 3. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(d) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul Chiasson, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the New Brunswick Milk Dealers Association, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 4. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2), 5(3) and paragraph 5(4)(f) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Kevin McKendy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, nominated by the Minister, effective June 4, 2019, for a term of five years. 272 5. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2), 5(3) and paragraph 5(4)(f) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kevin McKendy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, nominated by the Minister, as Vice- Chairperson, effective July 12, 2018, for a term to expire June, 3, 2024. 6. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and 5(3) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert Shannon, Douglas, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and is appointed Chairperson, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 12 July 2018. Deputy Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier suppléant du Conseil exécutif Labi. Gunn rneidioys

name: Gerard Robichaud
body: 273 JULY 12, 2018 2018-273 1. Under paragraphs 3(1)(a) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints, on the recommendation of the Minister, Andrew Green, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 2: Under paragraphs 3(1)(d) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints James Maurice Harquail, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing the Department of Energy and Resource Development, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of four years. 3. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lisa Barkley, Baie Verte, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing producers, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Claude Pelletier, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing producers, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of two years. 273 5. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerard Robichaud, Neguac, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing forest industries, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of two years. body: 273 JULY 12, 2018 2018-273 1. Under paragraphs 3(1)(a) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints, on the recommendation of the Minister, Andrew Green, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 2: Under paragraphs 3(1)(d) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints James Maurice Harquail, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing the Department of Energy and Resource Development, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of four years. 3. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lisa Barkley, Baie Verte, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing producers, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Claude Pelletier, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing producers, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of two years. 273 5. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerard Robichaud, Neguac, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing forest industries, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of two years. name: Victor Somerville
position: member engaged directly as a producer
body: 272 JULY 12, 2018 2018-272 fe Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(e) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Victor Somerville, Juniper, New Brunswick, as a member engaged directly as a producer, of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 2. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(c) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert Speer, Holmesville, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the Dairy Farmers of New Brunswick, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 3. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(d) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul Chiasson, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the New Brunswick Milk Dealers Association, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 4. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2), 5(3) and paragraph 5(4)(f) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Kevin McKendy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, nominated by the Minister, effective June 4, 2019, for a term of five years. 272 5. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2), 5(3) and paragraph 5(4)(f) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kevin McKendy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, nominated by the Minister, as Vice- Chairperson, effective July 12, 2018, for a term to expire June, 3, 2024. 6. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and 5(3) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert Shannon, Douglas, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and is appointed Chairperson, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. name: Robert Eckstein
body: 254 JULY4, 2018 2018-254 3p Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lynn Chaplin, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as vice-chair of the New Brunswick Police Commission, effective July 4, 2018, for the remainder of her current term to expire October 6, 2018. 2 Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Lynn Chaplin, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a part-time member and vice-chair of the New Brunswick Police Commission, effective October 7, 2018, for a term of three years. 3i Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Robert Eckstein, New Maryland, New Brunswick, as a part-time member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, effective July 4, 2018, for a term of two years. 4. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John W. Foran, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a part-time member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, effective July 4, 2018, for a term of two years. 5. Under subsection 26.1(1) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes paragraph (b) of Order in Council 2017-117 dated May 18, 2017. 254 6. Under subsection 26.1(1) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes paragraph 1(a) of Order in Council 2015-177 dated August 5, 2015. name: Valentina Cojocaru
body: 192 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-192 1. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michel Boudreau, Shediac, New Brunswick, as Chief Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 2. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cody Boudreau, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 3. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Valentina Cojocaru, Saint Jacques, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 4. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Dominic Gould, Grand Barachois, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 5. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Joshua MacDougald, Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 6. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Natasha Phillips, South Nelson, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. te Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2013-334 dated October 30, 2013. 192 8. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2016-106 dated May 4, 2016. 9. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraphs (b), (e), (f), (w), (x) and (aa) of Order in Council 2017-22 dated February 3, 2017. 10. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (b) of Order in Council 97-795 dated November 12, 1997. 71. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends Appendix A of Order in Council 2014-305 dated August 6, 2014 by revoking the following: (a) Martial Cormier, Bathurst, New Brunswick; and (b) Sébastien Cyr, Edmundston, New Brunswick. 12. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends Appendix A of Order in Council 2015-15 dated February 5, 2015 by revoking the following: (a) Ronald Crawford, Woodstock, New Brunswick; (b) Reggie Guay, Edmundston, New Brunswick; and (c) Scott Hamilton, Woodstock, New Brunswick. 192 13. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (f) of Order in Council 2016-170 dated July 12, 2016. name: Gillian Paul
body: 202 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-202 1: Under subsection 18(1) and paragraph 23(1)(a) of the University of New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Allison McCain, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, as Chancellor of the University of New Brunswick, effective August 28, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2023. 2. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gillian Paul, Killarney Road, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective September 2, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 3: Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Janet Hoyt, Toronto, Ontario, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective September 2, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 4. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robyn Tingley, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective November 21, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 202 5. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Thomas Gribbons, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective November 21, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. body: 201 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-201 4 Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Anne Gauvin, Riverview, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, representing the public at large, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2018. 2. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Marianne Mallia, Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, representing the public at large, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2018. 3. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Benjamin Wolthers, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, representing the public at large, for a term of three years, effective June 17, 2018. 4. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Rebecca Deveau Crofts, Nackawic, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, representing the New Brunswick Public Libraries Board, for a term of two years, effective June 6, 2018. 201 5. Under subsection 7(3) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Julie Gallant, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, effective June 6, 2018, for a term ending July 9, 2019. name: Sheila Murray
body: 200 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-200 1. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Bill Campbell, St. George, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region 8, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2018. De: Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Monica Plourde, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region 10, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2018. 3. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gary Mersereau, Fredericton Junction, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region 9, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2018. 4. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sheila Murray, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region 7, for a term of three years, effective June 16, 2018. 5. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Jeanne Smith, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region 6, for a term of three years, effective June 16, 2018. 200 6. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 7 of Order in Council 2017-172 dated July 10, 2017. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sheila Murray, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region 7, for a term of three years, effective June 16, 2018. 5. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Jeanne Smith, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region 6, for a term of three years, effective June 16, 2018. 200 6. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 7 of Order in Council 2017-172 dated July 10, 2017. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of-the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 6 June 2018. Deputy Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier suppléant du Conseil exécutif

name: Janet Hoyt
body: 202 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-202 1: Under subsection 18(1) and paragraph 23(1)(a) of the University of New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Allison McCain, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, as Chancellor of the University of New Brunswick, effective August 28, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2023. 2. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gillian Paul, Killarney Road, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective September 2, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 3: Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Janet Hoyt, Toronto, Ontario, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective September 2, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 4. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robyn Tingley, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective November 21, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 202 5. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Thomas Gribbons, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective November 21, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 6 June 2018. Deputy Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier suppléant du Conseil exécutif Patria Gorm finger

name: Michel Boudreau
body: 192 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-192 1. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michel Boudreau, Shediac, New Brunswick, as Chief Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 2. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cody Boudreau, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 3. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Valentina Cojocaru, Saint Jacques, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 4. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Dominic Gould, Grand Barachois, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 5. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Natasha Phillips, South Nelson, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. te Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2013-334 dated October 30, 2013. 192 8. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2016-106 dated May 4, 2016. 9. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (b) of Order in Council 97-795 dated November 12, 1997. 71. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends Appendix A of Order in Council 2014-305 dated August 6, 2014 by revoking the following: (a) Martial Cormier, Bathurst, New Brunswick; and (b) Sébastien Cyr, Edmundston, New Brunswick. 12. name: Lynn Ouellette Sauvageau
body: 95 MARCH 21, 2018 2018-95 1. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Amélie Deschénes, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 2: Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Scott Green, Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 3: Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Yvonne Samson, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 4. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom MacFarlane, Nashwaak Bridge, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 5. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Carol Desrosiers, Beresford, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 95 6. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lynn Ouellette Sauvageau, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 7. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Carla Gregan-Burns, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 8. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dominic Aubé, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 9. Under paragraph 4(1)(b) and subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Eric Beaulieu, Deputy Minister of Social Development, as President of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, effective March 21, 2018. name: Diane Deschénes
body: 84 MARCH 14, 2018 2018-84 1. Under section 2.1 of the Intimate Partner Violence Intervention Act and subsection 5(2) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates, as a category of persons, Emergency Adjudicative Officers appointed under the Judicature Act, as a designated authority for the purposes of the Intimate Partner Violence Intervention Act, to hear, and make determinations on, applications for emergency intervention orders. 2. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tammy Moore, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 30, 2018. 3. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Tammy Moore, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 30, 2018. 4. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Tammy Moore, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 30, 2018. 5. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Brian Maude, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 84 6. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Brian Maude, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 7. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Brian Maude, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 9, 2018. 8. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Diane Deschénes, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 9. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Diane Deschénes, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 10. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Diane Deschénes, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 9, 2018. 11. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 84 12. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 13. Under subsections 56.9(1) and 56.9(2) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chief Hearing Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 14. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Anne Richard, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 15. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Anne Richard, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 9, 2018. 16. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Matthew Cripps, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 17. Under section 61 and subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes: (a) Order in Council 2014-46 dated February 20, 2014; (b) Order in Council 96-316 dated March 21, 1996; and 84 (c) Order in Council 2000-184 dated April 20, 2000. 18. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2015-255 dated October 28, 2015. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 14 March 2018. Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil exécutif

Under subsections 56.9(1) and 56.9(2) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chief Hearing Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 14. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2015-255 dated October 28, 2015. name: Denis Pinet
body: 83 FEBRUARY 28, 2018 2018-83 4’; Under subsection 9(1) of the Elections Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following persons as Returning Officers for the indicated electoral districts: (a) Denis Pinet, for electoral district 26, Sussex-Fundy-St. Martins; (b) Patrick McCaffrey, for electoral district 32, Saint John Harbour; (c) Camille R. Malenfant, for electoral district 39, New Maryland- Sunbury; and (d) Judi Sloat, for electoral district 41, Fredericton North. 2: Under subsection 9(1) of the Elections Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes: (a) paragraph (z) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; (b) paragraph (ff) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; (c) paragraph (mm) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; 83 (d) paragraph (00) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; 3. Under subsection 9(1) of the Elections Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends paragraph (dd) of the French version of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017 by striking out “Perche” where it appears therein and substituting therefor “Rod”. name: Cathy LaRochelle
body: 45 JANUARY 30, 2018 2018-45 4's Under subsections 3(1), 3(2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and designates her as Chair, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 2. Under subsections 3(1), 3(2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sadie Perron, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member, of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and designates her as Vice- Chair, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul Fudge, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jan Rademaker, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing agriculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 45 5. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Brian McCullum, Pearsonville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing agriculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 6. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Bev Bacon, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing fisheries and aquaculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. G Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Benson Milner, Pointe-du- Chéne, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing fisheries and aquaculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 8. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Doris Losier, Bouctouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing fisheries and aquaculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. name: Yves Banville
body: 46 JANUARY 30, 2018 2018-46 fl: Under paragraph 2(2)(a) and subsections 2(3), 2(4) and 3(1) of the Agriculture Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul Jordan, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member and vice-chair of the Agriculture Appeal Board, nominated by the Minister of Environment and Local Government, for a term of five years, effective January 31, 2018. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Eddy Robichaud, Shippagan, New Brunswick, representing producers, as vice-chair of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(d) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerald Chevrier, Stanley, New Brunswick, who is employed within the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018.. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephanie Cormier, Drummond, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 14 5, Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Murphy Friesen, Greenfield, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. Under section 24 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-61, the General Regulation — Family Income Security Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 2(d) of Order in Council 2015-58 dated March 26, 2015. name: Martine Marchand
body: 3 JANUARY 2, 2018 2018-3 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 7(1) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the New Brunswick Association of CBDCs, a member organization, represented by Line Doiron, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2018. 2. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the New Brunswick Aboriginal People's Council, a member organization, represented by Wendy Wetteland, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Martine Marchand, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 4. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Louise Seales, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 5. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patricia Morris, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 3 -2 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the Fredericton Sexual Assault Centre, represented by Jennifer Richard, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 7. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (f) of Order in Council 2017-105, dated May 4, 2017. body: 322 DECEMBER 22, 2017 2017-322 Under subsection 2(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective September 5, 2017: (a) The Honourable Andrew Harvey, Minister of Agriculture, Mines and Rural Affairs; (b) The Honourable Rick Doucet, Minister of Aquaculture and Fisheries; (c) The Honourable Roger Melanson, Minister of Post-Secondary Education; and (d) The Honourable Gilles LePage, Minister of Labour, Employment and Population Growth. Under subsections 30(2), 30(3) and 30(5) of the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Daniel Jardine, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the south (zones 1, 2, 3 and 7), for a term of five years, effective November 22, 2017. 3. Under subsections 30(2), 30(3) and 30(5) of the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tania Perron, Campbellton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the north (zones 4, 5 and 6), for a term of five years, effective November 22, 2017. 9. (b) Clem Tremblay, for electoral district 02, Campbellton- Dalhousie; (c) Martial McLaughlin, for electoral district 03, Restigouche- Chaleur; (d) Mark Guindon, for electoral district 04, Bathurst West- Beresford; (e) Juliette McGraw, for electoral district 05, Bathurst East- Nepisiquit-Saint-Isidore; (f) Aldrice Comeau, for electoral district 06, Caraquet; (g) Emelie Richard, for electoral district 07, Shippagan-Lameque- Miscou; (h) Weldon McLaughlin, for electoral district 08, Tracadie-Sheila; (i) Rheal Fournier, for electoral district 09, Miramichi Bay-Neguac; (j) Paul Matheson, for electoral district 10, Miramichi; 303 2 (k) Patricia Price, for electoral district 11, Southwest Miramichi- Bay du Vin; (I) Donald Arsenault, for electoral district 12, Kent North; (m) Simonne Belliveau, for electoral district 13, Kent South; (n) Diane Gallant, for electoral district 14, Shediac Bay-Dieppe; (o) Anita Leger-MacDonald, for electoral district 15, Shediac- Beaubassin-Cap Pele; (p) Bill Hicks, for electoral district 16, Memramcook-Tantramar; (q) O'Neil Arseneau, for electoral district 17, Dieppe; (r) Paul LeBlanc, for electoral district 18, Moncton East; (s) Leo Belliveau, for electoral district 19, Moncton Centre; (t) Claudette Trewin, for electoral district 20, Moncton South; (u) Floyd Graves, for electoral district 21, Moncton Northwest; (v) Clifford Lavigne, for electoral district 22, Moncton Southwest; (w) Dean Johnston, for electoral district 23, Riverview; (x) Deborah Brine, for electoral district 24, Albert; (y) Neil Orchard, for electoral district 25, Gagetown-Petitcodiac; (z) Bonnie Wilson, for electoral district 26, Sussex-Fundy-St. Martins; 303 3 (aa) John Cairns, for electoral district 27, Hampton; (bb) Richard Mackie, for electoral district 28, Quispamsis; (cc) Victorine Robichaud, for electoral district 29, Rothesay; (dd) Rod Borden, for electoral district 30, Saint John East; (ee) Elaine O'Leary, for electoral district 31, Portland-Simonds; (ff) Ann Marie Gillis, for electoral district 32, Saint John Harbour; (gg) Mary McAuliffe, for electoral district 33, Saint John Lancaster; (hh) Terry Campbell, for electoral district 34, Kings Centre; (ii) Tina Belliveau-Moore, for electoral district 35, Fundy-The Isles-Saint John West; (jj) Lynn Kozak, for electoral district 36, Saint Croix; (kk) Blake Kennedy, for electoral district 37, Oromocto-Lincoln- Fredericton; (II) Vanessa Clark, for electoral district 38, Fredericton-Grand Lake; (mm) Theresa Carr, for electoral district 39, New Maryland- Sunbury; (nn) Karen Hammel, for electoral district 40, Fredericton South; (oo) Gordon Wilson, for electoral district 41, Fredericton North; 303 4 (pp) Robert Agnew, for electoral district 42, Fredericton-York; (qq) Linda Allison, for electoral district 43, Fredericton West- Hanwell; (rr) Avis Fitton, for electoral district 44, Carleton-York; (ss) Judy Macintosh, for electoral district 46, Carleton-Victoria; (tt) Anne Turcotte, for electoral district 47, Victoria-La Vallee; (uu) Rino Pelletier, for electoral district 48, Edmundston- Madawaska Centre; and (vv) Daniele Dube, for electoral district 49, Madawaska Les Lacs- Edmundston. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouvemeur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 22 November 2017. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil executif

name: Jacques Pinet
body: 304 NOVEMBER 22, 2017 2017-304 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cheryl Hansen as Acting Deputy Minister of Treasury Board, effective November 22, 2017, in place of Gordon Gilman. 2. Under section 4 of the Financial Administration Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cheryl Hansen as Acting Secretary to Treasury Board, effective November 22, 2017, in place of Gordon Gilman. 3. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle as Acting Deputy Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries and Acting Deputy Minister of Energy and Resource Development, effective January 1, 2018, in place of Jean Finn. 4. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Helene Bouchard as Acting Deputy Minister of Intergovernmental Affairs, effective January 1, 2018, in place of Bill Levesque. 5. Under section 3 of the Regional Development Corporation, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jacques Pinet as President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective May 1, 2018, in place of Bill Levesque. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 22 November 2017. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil executif
